fields.description: Remote API for SOAP does not have a feature to "Restore" a site from a backup file. I would strongly recommend such a feature as this would help to restore a site using a script rather than restoring through the Confluence Dashboard. Please add a method like restoreSite() for the same.
fields.summary: Remote API does not support restoring a site using a Backup file.

fields.summary: Exporting a site using exportSite() method of Remote SOAP API results in a confluence.importexport.impl.BackupExporter Error.
Assign a Theme to a space

fields.description:
Blank spaces are inserted into new table rows.

Creating a new issue because CONF-11508 is stuck at 2.7.3.
fields.summary: Blank space inserted in new table rows

fields.description: In the WYSIWYG editor, Verdana is being used for text inside tables instead of the Arial (?) used elsewhere.
fields.summary: Wrong font used inside tables in WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
Customer asks an improvement request regarding a space between subscript character and normal character. Please have a look at the following example:

PbZr ~x~ Ti ~1-x~ O ~3~ (PZT) layers

Please refer to the attachment for better clarification.
fields.summary: Erased a space between subscrip character and normal character

fields.description:
When you resize the rich text editor, little editing controls with arrows and a cross appear in each table cell as you edit it. See attached screenshot.

These little controls are quite destructive -- you can remove an entire cell containing a lot of content with one click.
fields.summary: Rich text editor table cell editing controls appear when editor is resized
code macro is not rendered properly in IE 6

fields.description:
The "Confluence Compatibility Macros" plugin and Adaptivist's "Content Formatting Macros" plugin both provide a {{\{table\}}} macro.  If you have both of these installed and enabled then with Sun Java 5 when you used {{\{table\}}} in a page it rendered it using the macro Adaptivist's plugin.  However with Sun Java 6 it seems to render it with _both_ macros and produces invalid HTML.

It would be good if Confluence could prevent two macros with the same name from being active at the same time.  Or at the very least warn you in a very obvious way.  Maybe the best place for this is in the Plugin Repository?  When you enable a plugin which implements a macro which is already defined by another plugin then Confluence could give you a choice between which of the two implementations of the macro to use.

(This issue was originally raised in [CSP-20301|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-20301]).
fields.summary: mangled output from duplicate macros with Java 6

fields.description:
*Problem*: Users have SSL terminated to Apache and Confluence and Jira running in same tomcat. Actually jiraissues needs Preservehost but it breaks the SSL termination.

While people can use Confluence with SSL terminated at Apache with mod_proxy, the Jiraissues macro doesn't work properly. However, configuring mod_jk made it work correctly.
fields.summary: Confluence with SSL terminated at Apache with mod_proxy, the Jiraissues macro doesn't work properly

fields.description:
Currently, if a user/group is NOT granted with the space "Remove" news permission, the user/group still can see the "Remove News" link via *News -> Edit*. Once the user clicking on the "Remove News" link, it will redirect to the following message:
{noformat}
You cannot view this page due to inherited restrictions

Page level restrictions have been applied to a parent of the current page. These restrictions limit access
 to only certain certain user(s) or group(s) and apply to all pages in the hierarchy underneath the parent.
{noformat}

The "Remove News" link shouldn't exist if the user/group is not granted with the space "Remove" news permission. This problem doesn't occur in Confluence 2.8 and 2.8.1 if the default theme is used. However, it happens to other themes.
fields.summary: Remove news link still visible for those user/group which is not granted with remove news permission
Park issue :)

fields.description: Search for "Production champion" - I didn't find the obvious result on EAC http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Production+champion
fields.summary: Searching does not find my search term even though a page even has this term in the title

fields.description: The list of plugins on the 500 page is fairly useless in its current state. It should be sorted by name for support staff to quickly identify whether a plugin is installed.
fields.summary: Sort the list of installed plugins on the '500' error-page
Create the ability to list the spaces created in the last month

fields.description:
This allows plugins (or just about any other classes in Confluence) to listen to the events to do their processing.

The new events in Confluence 2.8.3 and later are in an inheritance hierarchy like this:

* NotificationEvent
** ContentNotificationEvent
*** ContentNotificationAddedEvent
*** ContentNotificationRemovedEvent
** SpaceNotificationEvent
*** SpaceNotificationAddedEvent
*** SpaceNotificationRemovedEvent
** SiteNotificationEvent
*** SiteNotificationAddedEvent
*** SiteNotificationRemovedEvent

You can subscribe to all related events but creating an EventListener that listens for one of the parent classes.
fields.summary: Fire notification events when watches are added to or removed from pages and/or spaces

fields.description: Documentation needs to be written for developers so that they may understand the ramifications of the new HtmlSafe encoding system Confluence will use to render Velocity templates
fields.summary: Write developer documentation for HtmlSafe Velocity encoding

fields.description:
It's not at all clear that ~Macros~ won't be available to Team Hosted in the comparison table. Macros seem like such a ridiculously obvious requirement since Atlassian readily admits in many open bugs/RFEs that the baseline features of Confluence are meant to allow for maximum customization. So since you won't support font sizing or formatting (e.g. centering) then being able to make Macros becomes a baseline requirement.

This is a Critical because 1) the sales pitch for Team Hosted is misleading between the comparison table, demo, and links within the sites and 2) it's ridiculously hard to format anything as it stands and without macros a user ends up with a unreadable site quickly.
fields.summary: Macro support in Team Hosted to provide actual usability of Team Hosted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12332].
  {panel}

*Situtation*
- links using shortcuts must specify the tool-tip manually for each instance, there is no default

*Details*
- for a shortcut such as \[myword@wiktionary\], the default tool tip should read "Look up myword at wiktionary.org".
- I cannot specify a tooltip in the exapanded value, or the default alias
- I would like to specify the tool tip as something like "Look up %s at wiktionary.org"

*Recommendation*
- Add another column in global shortcut definitions that permit specification of a default tool-tip. 
-- Include %s injection of the ''shortcut word' in the tool-tip.
-- Include %k injection of the 'shortcut key' in the tool-top
- Include a _default_ default tool-tip of "Look up %s at %k" for any shortcut that does not have a specific tooltip pattern defined.
- the _default_ default tooltip can be overridded by the admin by specifying the 'Default Tooltip:" for each shortcut in the shortcuts admin panel.
- The tooltip for a specific link in a page can be overridden by a user specifying something like \[myword|myword@wiktionary|My tooltip\] if desired
fields.summary: Global Shortcuts do not show default tooltip or permit admin to specify a default tooltop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12331].
  {panel}

Since 3 days the export function of our confluence space fails. Seems not to be dependend of the user or chosen export format. Export ends after 5-10 seconds with following statement:
Exporting Space
Time Elapsed: 5 seconds
Time Remaining: Unknown (estimated)
Completion: 0% complete
 
There was an error in the export. Please check your log files. :Couldn't backup database data.

Making backups impossible - help! :P
fields.summary: export failure of confluence space

fields.description:
The Confluence's default theme contains most of the script in the html {{head}} section. This is a bad practice that unnecessary slows down loading of Confluence pages. 

Significant performance improvement can be achieved by simply moving the script tags to the bottom of the {{main}} template. 

This is currently not possible because {{#requireResource}} macro always renders the javascript tag in the head section.
fields.summary: Move included JavaScript tags to the bottom of HTML pages
Confluence unnecessarily leases db connections for the asset files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12327].
  {panel}

When this macro is rendered, the summary of results area appears on the page before the questions. (Of course, it says I can't see the results until I vote and then it will display the summary preceeding the questions.) I'd like to reverse that order, allowing the results to be displayed on the page after the questions appear, like
Question

    * choice
    * choice
    * choice

Summary

Results

Can it be added to the parameter set?
fields.summary: Macros - Survey Macro - rendering layout

fields.description:
It is an unfortunate practice at Atlassian to as a part of release notes release all the information, often including [example exploits|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9350], about security vulnerabilities that were fixed in the version being released.

This gives us great headaches because:
* we often don't know when the next release is because of varying release dates, so we can't plan ahead
* we might not be able to drop everything and rush to upgrade our version of Confluence the day when the new version is released

We would prefer much more to be just notified that the latest release fixes security vulnerabilities, and have a period of e.g. 30 or more days to upgrade before any details are revealed publicly. This is how many projects (open sourced, or commercial) work and this practice is favored in the security community as well.
fields.summary: Do not release details about securrity vulnerabilities until after the fix was available for a reasonable period of time
Blog-posts macro needs to have an option to filter based on publication date
Allow users to subscribe to less frequent email preferences
Improve column headings used on view attachments page

fields.description:
To reproduce: 

1) Attach two versions of the same attachment
2) Note the last modification dates of attachments
3) Move time forward on your machine and add comment to latest version of attachment 
4) Observe all last modification dates have changed.
fields.summary: Update attachment comment should not update last modification date of all historical versions

fields.description: As shown in the attached screenshot, the "Login To Confluence" screen that is presented when a user is not permitted to see their target page can feature a giant rendition of the Confluence logo.  This has only been seen so far on "www.onconfluence.com"
fields.summary: "Not Permitted" login page has extremely large logo
Adding users to a large group is slow with default (Hibernate) user management

fields.description:
Inserting the {metadata} macro in the table in the wiki-markup mode and switching to the Rich-text mode, without saving, breaks the table formatting with additional *[div class=]* value added before and after the macro usage.

To reproduce, please copy and past the attached wiki-markup in the Wiki-Markup mode and without saving, switch to the Rich-text mode.
fields.summary: Inserting {metadata} macro in a table, breaks table formatting in rich-text mode

fields.description: Cause unknown at the moment.
fields.summary: PersonalSpaceAcceptanceTest.testCreatePersonalSpaceRetainsPersonalProfile fails intermittently

fields.description:
I get a download error in the plugin repository for the calendar plugin. Error is attached.

Unable to find valid certification path to requested target.

I see this relatively often, but this time only on the calendar plugin. The others are updating just fine.

The workaround of uninstall reinstall did NOT work, and also tried downloading and uploading the jar. Right now, the plugin will not install or enable and we did have it in use on the older version before.

Please advise, thanks
fields.summary: Downloading error in plugin repository
Would like to be able to remove ALL watches with one click.

fields.description:
HOW TO REPRODUCE:
*Type four lines: First line is Heading 2. Second line is normal text. Third line is Heading 2. Fourth line is normal text.
*Put cursor in middle of third line (with Heading 2 style).
*Change heading from Heading 2 to Heading 3 using drop down.

WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN: entire heading should change to Heading 3, and cursor should not move.

WHAT ACTUALLY HAPPENS: heading does change, but cursor jumps to an arbitrary, invalid location that is above the changed heading but in vertical space that is supposed to be between paragraphs.
fields.summary: Change block style (Headings) causes cursor to jump to invalid location

fields.description:
Since we have upgraded from Confluence 2.5.2 to 2.8.1, Links inside the Testplan-Plugin ( see <http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Testplan+Plugins>) wont get updated, when the referenced site is renamed. This is a regression for us, because it worked with Confluence 2.5.2.

Any advice is welcome, how to revert to the previous, correct behavior.
fields.summary: When renaming a page, Links inside the Testplan-Plugin wont get updated

fields.description:
According to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+Standalone+on+Windows+from+Zip+File#InstallingConfluenceStandaloneonWindowsfromZipFile-2.InstalltheJDK%28JavaDevelopmentKit%29, it is necesasry to install the entire Java Development Kit (JDK).

I question this because the JDK is the JRE plus development tools. Standard practices maximizing security and performance require installing the minimal software necessary to get the job done. The more software installed, the more tools available to malicious users, and the more things to break.

Is it really necessary to install the entire JDK? Why not just the JRE?

I think this is a bug because I cannot think of why the JDK would be required, but I went ahead and filed as an improvement in case I misinterpreted something.
fields.summary: Is JDK really necessary?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12310].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Login as admin/123
2. Go to ADMIN - WIKI ADMIN and select 'General Configuration' under 'Configuration' in the left panel
3. Go to 'Attachment Settings' section and сlick 'Edit' button
4. Fill in all fileds with negative values and click 'Save' button

Expected result:
Error messages appear, informing that values must be positive

Actual result:
Values are saved

Note: It should be eihter ability to input 0 in 'Maximum Attachments per Form' (then there will no 'Attach File' section in 'Attachment' tab of any wiki page) or prohibition to input 0
fields.summary: Improve validation of maximum attachment size, setting to zero should disable attachments

fields.description:
Enter a label that does not exist in the path of your base confluence install http://{base}/label/{random_label}. This redirects to 404 Page not found response.

If the label exists in the confluence database, but it is not in use, then this redirects to the normal viewlabel.vm template which handles the situation correctly.

If the label does not exist in the confluence database, then this redirects to the 404 response.

The ideal behaviour should be that any errors with label handling be done in a central place such as viewlabel.java. At the moment, the responsability of checking for if a label exists is done at the LabelServlet.java level. Instead of letting the Xworks mechanism follow its course, the LabelServlet triggers a 404 response for unknown labels. If this had been let to filter down to the viewlabel.action, this bug would have been avoided.
fields.summary: LabelServlet breaks viewlabel.action functionality.
When users are referenced using [~userid], if the user is disabled, the userid is shown in red, as opposed to what the username was (and being in red)

fields.description:
Currently, if i am watching a space, i will receive email notifications when someone creates or upload any attachments.
This creates a email spam unnecessary. It should be coupled with a default turn off (via checkbox) when the page has been edited by the same person. Otherwise there will also be email notifications when a user tries to save in order to preview.

The page history should also be able to be compressed thus reducing on the number of unnecessary versions.
fields.summary: Provide an option for user to turn notification on/off

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :

# Open Page A (any page)
# Create new link in rte using create/new link button :
#* Enter link name as Link3
#* Enter Alias as Link3
#* Enter tool top as " This is the tool tip for Link3" 
# Save Page A
# Click on Link3 to create the New Page. At this stage, the New Page with page title " This is the tool tip for Link3"  instead of link name 'Link3'. Please see attached screen shot.

The problem happens only when values for  Link Name and Alias are the same. Happens in both IE and Firefox.
fields.summary: Tooltip becomes page title

fields.description:
I created a Wiki entry by pasting in this text.
{noformat}
You can make your phone ring longer than 15 seconds before it diverts.  Obviously this should be handy for when you're on call.

Type in the following

**004*number# (all diversions)
**61*number**delay# (not answered)

OR

**61*number**delay# (not answered)
**62*number# (unreachable)


**67*number# (busy)
{noformat}

For some reason, it interpreted the first series of ** in each paragraph as bold, but subsequent lines appeared as a literal **.

I went to the wiki markup page to correct this, and added a backslash before each * to ensure it wasn't interpreted as bold.

Annoyingly, after making another change to the page, my backslashes were forgotten and it went back to the first line of **s being bold.

I'm using Firefox 3.0 on Linux.
fields.summary: ** keeps getting unescaped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12303].
  {panel}

the url to the login screen can contain any random text:  
http://localhost:8080/*ulilovesconfluence*/login.action
will successfully log a user into confluence.
Note: the application context is *not* set to ulilovesconfluence
fields.summary: Any action in the default package can be prefixed with an arbitrary leading path and still be resolved

fields.description:
Inserting a link in the wiki markup mode in IE (tested IE6 and IE7) inserts the link at the end of the page. The correct behaviour should be to insert the link where the cursor is. Inserting a link in the Rich Text Editor mode works as expected.

Step to replicate:
# When editing a page in wiki markup mode using IE7, place the cursor somewhere other than the bottom of the page. 
# Hit the insert link icon and type any link. 
# Select OK. 
# The selected link gets inserted at the bottom of the page instead of where the cursor was.

When using Safari 3.1.1 on OS X or Firefox 3.0 on Linux and Firefox 2 on Windows, the link gets placed where the cursor is.
fields.summary: When inserting a Link in a Wiki Markup Mode in IE, the new link is included at the end of the page instead of where the cursor is

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Using the Rich Text Editor, type 'Enter'.
2. Save the page.
3. The carriage return is displayed as two carriage returns.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor converts one carriage return to two

fields.description:
See attached screenshot.

It happens only when the user clicks "Add Comment". When editing pages the tabs are shown correctly.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-20510
fields.summary: "Add Comment" Editor tabs cover up formatting icons

fields.description:
See screenshot attached.

Text size was not changed by the user. 

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-20510
fields.summary: Options in Tools menu are not displayed properly in IE7

fields.description: Need a wiki markup checker that can help check unclosed parentheses or unclosed wiki markup of the installed macros.
fields.summary: Request for a wiki markup checker

fields.description:
With atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip no longer in the source directory, Intellij will not add the zip to the WAR it builds (this is despite the fact that it is in the target directory and Maven will quite happily pick it up); I was able to work around this by copying the zip back to its old location, but this could become tiresome and error prone. Is there any way to work around this?

We also do a fair bit of tinkering with the rpc plugins and I am wondering if these changes will make development slightly more difficult for the Sydney team; I suppose we can always add the plugins as dependent modules but this will get blown away every time we do a mvn idea:idea.
fields.summary: Mitigate the development pains that have arisen from the antistatic branch merge

fields.description:
When navigating via URLs, you need to respect case in the space key if you are using a customised layout. Otherwise, the customised layout is not applied. This could lead to some weird problems.

For example on CAC, if you use the correct case in the DOC space then you see the left-hand nav bar:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home

But if you use the wrong case, you see the page without the left-hand nav bar:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/doc/Confluence+Documentation+Home
fields.summary: Custom space layout (and potentially other areas of Confluence's functionality) require a case-sensitive space key

fields.description:
To reproduce the error:
# Open a page on CAC.
# Edit the page.
# Click "Edit" next to "Restrictions".
# In the text box, start typing the name of a group (or whatever). You are offered some previously-used info, which is good.
# Select a previously-used group name. It appears in the text box as it should, but then immediately you get the spinning icon and the text disappears, reverting to the partial text you had originally typed. And you get a big red error message saying "Invalid user or group names".
fields.summary: Auto-complete on page restrictions is not working

fields.description:
Confluence runs fine except when trying to set it up as a service.  Registering the service using service.bat works fine.  However, when trying to start the service windows indicates an error 0 is returned by tomcat.

When taking a look in the logs, the following error messages are found (jakarta_service_DDMMYYYY.log):

[2008-06-30 23:40:21] [info] Running Service...
[2008-06-30 23:40:21] [info] Starting service...
[2008-06-30 23:40:21] [174  javajni.c] [error] %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
[2008-06-30 23:40:21] [947  prunsrv.c] [error] Failed creating java C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll
[2008-06-30 23:40:21] [1202 prunsrv.c] [error] ServiceStart returned 1
[2008-06-30 23:40:25] [info] Run service finished.
[2008-06-30 23:40:25] [info] Procrun finished.

After replacing the tomcat.exe and tomcatw.exe binaries by 64-bit versions, downloaded from the internet everything seems to work fine.

The following links are related:

* http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257280313    (core problem not found)
* http://threebit.net/mail-archive/tomcat-users/msg11584.html     (32-64 bit problem identified, workaround suggested)

I think either the installation guide should be adjusted to indicate this problem for 64-bit users (current verions) or the installation package should be adjusted such that the right version of tomcat is called, depending on the OS (new versions).
fields.summary: Installing Confluence as a service on XP-64 fails due to 32-bit binaries of Tomcat

fields.description: Hello please see attachment. When browsing our drafts in 2.8.1 the page titles do not show.
fields.summary: Draft Page Titles not displaying

fields.description:
When writing log to velocity.log, confluence throws java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError, which is org.apache.log.format.Formatter class.
This cause is that Avalon Logkit library is missing in the confluence application libraries.

This library binaries are distributed in the following location:
http://www.apache.org/dist/excalibur/excalibur-logkit/
fields.summary: Avalon Logkit library is missing.

fields.description: German and France language is not translated well when we enable those language pack.
fields.summary: German and France language pack is not translated well

fields.description:
To change system locale in Confluence Standalone, one will need to add the required JVM parameters in *setenv.bat* for example:
{noformat}
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Duser.language=ja
{noformat}

The above will change the locale to Japanese. 

An alternative would be to change Windows' *Regional and Language option* via the Control Panel.

However, when running Confluence as a Windows Service the same JVM parameter is not picked up in Confluence if saved in the Windows Registry. 

Changing Windows' *Regional and Language option* via the Control Panel does not work either.

We need a way to change the system locale for Confluence Windows Service, at least using the same way as it picks up the JVM parameter for setting the memory setting (eg. permgen) in the Windows Registry.
fields.summary: Need a way to change system locale in Confluence running as a Windows Service

fields.description:
This broke the Confluence dashboard on EAC, 2.9-m4, for some inexplicable reason:

{code}
Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isDefaultUserProfilePicture' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.util.GeneralUtil threw exception (Wrapped: CacheName=com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.properties.Hibernat
ePropertySetFactory.propertysets, Key=matt@atlassian.com) java.io.OptionalDataException @ /decorators/components/comments.vmd[2,24]
        ...
Caused by: (Wrapped: CacheName=com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.properties.HibernatePropertySetFactory.propertysets, Key=matt@atlassian.com) java.io.OptionalDataException
        at com.tangosol.coherence.component.util.CacheHandler.getCachedResource(CacheHandler.CDB:51)
        at com.tangosol.coherence.component.util.CacheHandler.get(CacheHandler.CDB:1)
        at com.tangosol.coherence.component.util.SafeNamedCache.get(SafeNamedCache.CDB:1)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.tangosol.TangosolCache.get(TangosolCache.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.user.impl.cache.properties.CachingPropertySetFactory.getPropertySet(CachingPropertySetFactory.java:47)
        at com.atlassian.user.impl.delegation.properties.DelegatingPropertySetFactory.getPropertySet(DelegatingPropertySetFactory.java:34)
        at bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor.getPropertySet(DefaultUserAccessor.java:561)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.getUserProfilePicture(DefaultUserAccessor.java:458)
{code}

Error message received by EAC user:

{noformat}
Cause:
org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:626)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Coherence cache fails while retrieving profile picture metadata (dashboard or view page shows UnexpectedRollbackException)

fields.description: When a user profile picture is uploaded that is more than 3x the size of the size that we crop to, present an interface to allow the user to pick a square portion of the picture to crop as their avatar
fields.summary: Interface for manually cropping uploaded user profile pictures

fields.description:
It seems the antistatic branch merge has greatly increased the startup / initial installation time when using Resin 2.1.x. The startup time now exceeds three minutes, which means that our acceptance tests die as SetupAcceptanceTest will only grant the server three minutes to perform the initial Spring context initialization and loading of the bundled plugins.

We have decided for now to simply specify a higher timeout and recommend customers do not run Confluence 2.9 with Resin 2.1.x.
fields.summary: Resin 2.1.x starts up much slower now

fields.description:
confluence-administrators group by default can access a restricted page.

However they cannot view a restricted page, for example in  the _List Pages - Tree View_ mode.
fields.summary: confluence-administrators group not able to see restricted page (in List Pages - Tree View mode)

fields.description:
Reported by customer

{quote}
How to reproduce:
*Create blank new page.
*The first line has Heading 2.
*The second line is normal paragraph text.
*Save page.
*Edit page.
*Put cursor at beginning of first line and press enter.

What SHOULD happen (if following WYSIWYG convention and norms is important to Atlassian): Heading 2 should be retained on first line.
What ACTUALLY happens: Heading 2 style dropped from that line and put on the blank new line instead.
{quote}
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor incorrectly removes heading formatting

fields.description: In the DOC space, if you have a code or noformat macro with very long lines, it will push the content on the page far out to the right, making it very hard to read.
fields.summary: Improve layout of documentation space so wide content does not make content wider than the screen
Improve the performance of UserAccessor.getMemberNames (listing of members of a group)
HTTP retrieval service should provide on-disk caching option

fields.description:
Seen on confluence.demo.atlassian.com. The "you are not logged in" warning is cleared underneath the wiki markup helper float, leading to a page full of whitespace. (See screenshot)

Steps to reproduce

# Edit a page with safari while not logged in

This is something that a lot of people will see on the demo site: bad first impression.
fields.summary: Huge whitespace above editor when editing a page anonymously with the wiki markup editor

fields.description: When I add news to a space, both the Labels:Edit and Posting Day: Edit links are mispointed. They both point to http://localhost:8080/pages/createblogpost.action?spaceKey=BOSCI; i.e. they just create new blank news. This appears to happen irrespective of user permissions, as I've tried it with users with varying permission levels up to full privs in the space and site admin.
fields.summary: Change Date and Labels links broken in Add News Page

fields.description:
Sometimes when editing, if the cursor is at the very, very end of a page, pressing backspace will cause the same thing to happen as if I pressed the browser's back button.

This seems to happen sporadically, and I haven't figured out how to precisely reproduce it.
fields.summary: When cursor at very end of page, backspace sometimes triggers browser back button

fields.description: When I edit an existing wiki page, an extra vertical space and a single space character (horizontal space) always appear at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: When editing existing page, extra space appears at bottom

fields.description: When I create a brand new wiki page, the document is actually populated with a  space character. New documents should have no characters.
fields.summary: Extra space appears in new wiki page

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
*Edit a lengthy page.
*Scroll down several pages.
*Type something.
*Type Ctrl-Z (undo).
*Type a few characters.

You have added text at the very top of the page in a brand new blank line that wasn't there when you started editing.
fields.summary: Undo causes erratic cursor movement

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
*Open brand new wiki page.
*Click in the editor to place the cursor in the editor.
*Click the format dropdown to select Heading 2.
*Type a few characters.

Notice how a blank line appears above the Heading 2. If I click on it, the format bar reverts to saying -- Format --.
fields.summary: Extra newline appears when converting to H2 in a new page

fields.description:
The norm in HTML and many other applications (e.g., Word) is that bullets in lists appear differently depending on how deeply the list is indented. HTML's norm is:
*Solid disc on first level.
*Open disc on second level.
*Solid square in third and deeper levels.

Confluence instead forces a solid disc on all levels in the HTML output. Curiously, Confluence correctly provides differentiated bullets in PDF and Word exports.

I'm sure I could hack something (CSS? theme?) to fix this, but the default behavior of well-designed applications never changes norms unless there is value in doing so.

There is no value in overriding useful, differentiated bullets with more opaque, homogeneous discs, so the default HTML behavior should have been preserved.
fields.summary: Bullet list styles do not differentiate upon indent

fields.description:
1- Create a new Confluence page
2- Give a non existing name to the page
3- Click the "insert image" icon
4- Click the "Browse" button, select an image, and click "Attach"
5- Click "Ok" to close the Dialog box: the text is updated with \!myImage.png\!
6- Save the page.
See that the image is not displayed

7- Open the "Tools" menu and select "attachments"
8- Click the attached document
You should get a "Attachment File Not Found " message
fields.summary: Adding an image to a non-created yet page leads to a non found attachment

fields.description: When shared mode is on we can not expose user details via the recently updated macro. Therefore userinfo items will have to be hidden by default if shared mode is turned on.
fields.summary: Do not display profile userinfo items in recently updated when "Shared Mode" is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12259].
  {panel}

The Windows machine hosts two instances of confluence. One 2.7.3 at http://lala-01/ the other instance of 2.5.4 at http://lala-01:8080/.
When I'm logged into the first instance, it automatically logs me out of the other one and vice versa.
So I guess the cookies conflict with each other.

When I would be able to be logged in at both instances at the same time I could work so much faster.
fields.summary: Confluence login cookie seems to conflict with other instance of Confluence cookie set on same machine
Backup file prefix required irrespective of daily backup status

fields.description: Currently an action can not define it's own breadcrumbs. The generation is completely handled in the BreadcumbGenerator class. To allow plugins to add their own breadcrumbs we should allow actions to implement a BreadcrumbAware interface.
fields.summary: Extend breadcrumb generator to allow for custom breadcrumbs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an unordered list with two levels,
{panel}
* Level 1
** Level 2
{panel}
2. Save the page,
3. Click Edit,
4. Put the cursor at the end of the first level line and click Return/Enter 

See result in the attached screenshot.

After this event the editor doesn't allow the user to edit the elements already inserted and can't create new elements properly (the new elements overlap the existing ones)
fields.summary: Two bullets appearing in the same line

fields.description:
We are improving the content of the Demo Space (DS) shipped with the Confluence download --- see CONF-11182.

The draft space is currently housed on EAC:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DRAFTDEMO/Home

We need to export and incorporate the space into the Confluence download. Must export, then remove the author info.
fields.summary: Include new demo space (DS) in Confluence download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12254].
  {panel}

It would be great if there was some kind of undo-functionality  or even an overall confirmation dialog  when moving pages per drag&drop in page tree-view.

Currently it is very "easy" to drag a page and drop it accidentally into the wrong location, for instance because a user is unaware of the drag&drop functionality when clicking at pagetree-entries or when someone does not know how to cancel a drag-operation. It seems to be that currently there is no easy and obvious way of undoing the operation.
It gets even more problematic when the user does not remember/know the former location of the accidentally moved page.

Generally, this kind of no-confirmation-just-do-it UI-experience seems to be somewhat unnatural in confluence, because other operations with similar impact do require a confirmation.
fields.summary: Undo for Page-Move Functionality

fields.description:
Indentation using keyboard (by pressing key "Tab" in keyboard) works in Firefox 2 and it does not work in Firefox 3, IE 6 and IE 7. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new page.
# Open the page in RTE editor.
# Click Bullet (Unordered List) in RTE editor.
# Press key "Tab" in your keyboard.

In Firefox 2, Indentation will work fine.
fields.summary: Bullet indentation with Tab key works in Firefox 2 but it does not work in Firefox 3, IE 6 and IE 7

fields.description:
The Wysiwyg editor doesn't load because the javascript served by the Tiny mce servlet is not returned. 

The Tinymce servlet is unavailable because when another plugin servlet such as gliffy fails to load and causes a javax.servlet.UnavailableException. This exception in turn causes the Confluence servlet serving the plugin servlets (ServletModuleContainerServlet) to be unloaded and hence the tinymce serlvet is unavailable. This problem should be fixed with PLUG-79.
fields.summary: Wysiwyg editor doesn't load up when gliffy plugin fails to load

fields.description:
This bug was found on:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PR/Home

As you can see in the screenshot I attached, you are promted to confirm that the task is to be deleted.  Even after confirming, the task is not deleted.  This problem persisted until I went into Safari (3.1.1.) where it works properly.
fields.summary: Tasks on Tasklist Cannot be deleted using Firefox 3.0

fields.description: Attaching screenshot to show what I'm seeing. I click edit on any page and the edit screen does not load correctly. I tried it in Safari and it loads fine. My default is rich text editor and of course safari only shows wiki markup.
fields.summary: Confluence edit is not loading properly in Firefox 3

fields.description:
I cannot add comment on Ubuntu with FF 3.0 (final version).
Preview button has no affect other than highlighting preview tab and showing empty control below my text (see attached screenshot).
Everything works perfectly with Opera for me and with FF 3.0 on Apple.

I am raising this issue as I didn't recall such problem with EAC yesterday or two days ago.
fields.summary: AJAX comments (preview) do not work for FireFox 3 on Ubuntu on 2.9-m4

fields.description: if your content has a positive z-index set (as some js widgets do), then the add and tools menu dropdowns in the default theme show up behind the content. this is because those dropdowns don't have a z-index in their css, while the menus in the header bar do. should probably do something like add a high z-index to .ajs-drop-down in menu.css. see screenshots
fields.summary: Menu dropdowns can appear behind JIRA issues macro

fields.description:
I just almost lost a long text on Extranet (FF had it cached, fortunately). I could only create the Milestone notes after three attempts. I lost it for the first time when switching between edit and preview mode, and then even the edit-mode (pressing save button) would not save my text, only the page and its title.

This all happened at 7:24 Sydney time, 25 JUNE, and should get investigated by the Writer team (who are looking at bugs there anyway), even though I am pretty sure the writer team has not caused the problem.

Actually, it seems that the preview tab is completely broken since today. Adnan reported this problem in the morning on FF3, and now I have it on FF2. On Safari all is fine though.
fields.summary: Preview and rich-text editor do not appear when adding comments or editing pages on EAC

fields.description:
|| Page | http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+by+Label+Macro |
|| Propose | The [optional parameters|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+by+Label+Macro#ContentbyLabelMacro-OptionalParameters] section does not describe or provide further description regarding the 'reverse" parameter which is a valid option when using the \{contentbylabel\}. However, it is being mentioned in the "sort" option description. It would be nice to also include a new row in the optional parameters section regarding the "reverse" parameter. This could help readers to be aware that "reverse" is a valid parameters. |
fields.summary: Provide information regarding the "reverse" parameter for Content by Label Macro

fields.description: I get an ugly red error message when a draft is autosaved - even though the saving of the draft worked fine (i checked from the drafts page)
fields.summary: Draft error message displayed even though all is well

fields.description: Can't see any of the editors when editing a page or trying to leave a comment.
fields.summary: Editor does not work in Firefox 3.0

fields.description: When using the blog-posts macro specifying labels = <some label> when there are no blogs or pages labeled with <some label> the whole list of blog posts shows up.  If a page is labeled with <some label> but no blog posts are labeled with this label, the blog-posts macro returns no results, as expected.  Of course, <some label> described above is a place holder for an arbitrary label like "natalia-blog".
fields.summary: Blog-posts macro shows all posts when limiting by a label that does not exist

fields.description:
* Export new downloadable PDF HTML and XML docs for Confluence 2.8.
* Upload onto Confluence download page in ALLDOC
* Link from main download page in ALLDOC

Reason: The 2.8 documentation has been updated and improved since the initial 2.8 downloadable docs were created.
fields.summary: Supply new downloadable PDF HTML and XML docs for Confluence 2.8
excerpt used in children macro doesn't process macros or line-breaks

fields.description:
There exists a page "Foo" in a space called "Space 1."

If I choose to copy (by clicking Copy) that page to "Space 2," the system suggests a name "Copy of Foo" (or similar, all's fine so far.)

While still in the edit mode, I change the title back to "Foo" and choose a destination space of "Space 2"  and click save, the system reports that "There already exists a page "Foo" in space "Space 1"" (or similar.) Which is kinda silly as I'm not creating that page to Space 1, but to Space 2.

To make this work I need to first create the copy, and then rename it to "Foo."

Not a biggy, but seriously annoying as it misleads innocent users.
fields.summary: Error message given when copying page to another space using original page name

fields.description:
The non default bundled themese don't know about the new _system.content.add_ web item location key (and probably others as well) that was introduced with confluence 2.8.  Plugins that use this new web item will not show up in the non default themes.

If the old _system.space.actions_ location is used with the default theme it also gets added to the menu so you end up with two web items, this means you can't use the correct location in the menu on the default theme and have the other bundled themes work correctly.
fields.summary: Non default themes need to be updated to know about new theme locations

fields.description:
See http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+CPU+Profiling

The page only contains the attachments macro.
fields.summary: Attachments macro on a page prevents the drop down macros from working

fields.description:
Hello,

after establishing the trusted application connection to Confluence and setting up the 'jiraissues' plugin in a Confluence page everything works fine except the 'cosmetic' icon under priority is not transfered.

Best regards,
Heiko
fields.summary: Cosmetic (priority) icon not shown when using jiraissues in Confluence
Can't link to news' attachment from other page

fields.description:
Often customers raise issues (performance, out of memory, failed daily backups, missing daily backups, backups silently failing, recently updated/indexing not working any more due to backups killing the scheduler threads) etc which are all due to daily backups being enabled. 

Manual backups are far more robust, faster to backup/restore and do not have a large impact on performance, means we should be pushing customers to using them, before they actually raise a case. 
On most production sites, customers will be using external databases where the DBA already backs up the database on a daily basis, making the switch easy. 

For this reason we should include a warning message (similar to the HSQL message we display) to warn customers that they have daily backups enabled and should disable them in favour of manual backups.
fields.summary: Create Warning message in Admin console for users that have Daily Backup enabled.
